revised_title: On the Measurement of the Chemical Action of Light: A New Photochemical Instrument
tldr: Researchers Bunsen and Roscoe developed a new instrument to measure the chemical action of light accurately. They used electrolysis of strong aqueous hydrochloric acid to create a gas containing equal volumes of chlorine and hydrogen, which was sensitive to light exposure. The new instrument allowed them to investigate the laws of chemical action of light and discover the phenomenon of photochemical induction.
